57/* Declare all of our malloc named types */
58MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_MAP, "sctp_map", "sctp asoc map descriptor");
59MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_STRMI, "sctp_stri", "sctp stream in array");
60MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_STRMO, "sctp_stro", "sctp stream out array");
61MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_ASC_ADDR, "sctp_aadr", "sctp asconf address");
62MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_ASC_IT, "sctp_a_it", "sctp asconf iterator");
63MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_AUTH_CL, "sctp_atcl", "sctp auth chunklist");
64MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_AUTH_KY, "sctp_atky", "sctp auth key");
65MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_AUTH_HL, "sctp_athm", "sctp auth hmac list");
66MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_AUTH_IF, "sctp_athi", "sctp auth info");
67MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_STRESET, "sctp_stre", "sctp stream reset");
68MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_CMSG, "sctp_cmsg", "sctp CMSG buffer");
69MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_COPYAL, "sctp_cpal", "sctp copy all");
70MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_VRF, "sctp_vrf", "sctp vrf struct");
71MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_IFA, "sctp_ifa", "sctp ifa struct");
72MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_IFN, "sctp_ifn", "sctp ifn struct");
73MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_TIMW, "sctp_timw", "sctp time block");
74MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_MVRF, "sctp_mvrf", "sctp mvrf pcb list");
75MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_ITER, "sctp_iter", "sctp iterator control");
76MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_SOCKOPT, "sctp_socko", "sctp socket option");
77MALLOC_DEFINE(SCTP_M_MCORE, "sctp_mcore", "sctp mcore queue");

79/* Global NON-VNET structure that controls the iterator */
80struct iterator_control sctp_it_ctl;
81#if !(defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__))
82
83static void
84sctp_cleanup_itqueue(void)
85{
86 struct sctp_iterator *it, *nit;
87
88 TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE(it, &sctp_it_ctl.iteratorhead, sctp_nxt_itr, nit) {
89 if (it->function_atend != NULL) {
90 (*it->function_atend) (it->pointer, it->val);
91 }
92 TAILQ_REMOVE(&sctp_it_ctl.iteratorhead, it, sctp_nxt_itr);
93 SCTP_FREE(it, SCTP_M_ITER);
94 }
95}
96#endif
97#if defined(__Userspace__)
98/*__Userspace__ TODO if we use thread based iterator
99 * then the implementation of wakeup will need to change.
100 * Currently we are using timeo_cond for ident so_timeo
101 * but that is not sufficient if we need to use another ident
102 * like wakeup(&sctppcbinfo.iterator_running);
103 */
104#endif
105
106void
107sctp_wakeup_iterator(void)
108{
109#if defined(SCTP_PROCESS_LEVEL_LOCKS)
110#if defined(_WIN32)
111 WakeAllConditionVariable(&sctp_it_ctl.iterator_wakeup);
112#else
113 pthread_cond_broadcast(&sctp_it_ctl.iterator_wakeup);
114#endif
115#else
116 wakeup(&sctp_it_ctl.iterator_running);
117#endif
118}
119
120#if defined(__Userspace__)
121static void *
122#else
123static void
124#endif
125sctp_iterator_thread(void *v SCTP_UNUSED)
126{
127#if defined(__Userspace__)
128 sctp_userspace_set_threadname("SCTP iterator");
129#endif
130 SCTP_IPI_ITERATOR_WQ_LOCK();
131 /* In FreeBSD this thread never terminates. */
132#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
133 for (;;) {
134#else
135 while ((sctp_it_ctl.iterator_flags & SCTP_ITERATOR_MUST_EXIT) == 0) {
136#endif
137#if !defined(__Userspace__)
138 msleep(&sctp_it_ctl.iterator_running,
139#if defined(__FreeBSD__)
140 &sctp_it_ctl.ipi_iterator_wq_mtx,
141#elif defined(__APPLE__)
142 sctp_it_ctl.ipi_iterator_wq_mtx,
143#endif
144 0, "waiting_for_work", 0);
145#else
146#if defined(_WIN32)
147 SleepConditionVariableCS(&sctp_it_ctl.iterator_wakeup, &sctp_it_ctl.ipi_iterator_wq_mtx, INFINITE);
148#else
149 pthread_cond_wait(&sctp_it_ctl.iterator_wakeup, &sctp_it_ctl.ipi_iterator_wq_mtx);
150#endif
151#endif
152#if !(defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__))
153 if (sctp_it_ctl.iterator_flags & SCTP_ITERATOR_MUST_EXIT) {
154 break;
155 }
156#endif
157 sctp_iterator_worker();
158 }
159#if !(defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__))
160 /* Now this thread needs to be terminated */
161 sctp_cleanup_itqueue();
162 sctp_it_ctl.iterator_flags |= SCTP_ITERATOR_EXITED;
163 SCTP_IPI_ITERATOR_WQ_UNLOCK();
164#if defined(__Userspace__)
165 sctp_wakeup_iterator();
166 return (NULL);
167#else
168 wakeup(&sctp_it_ctl.iterator_flags);
169 thread_terminate(current_thread());
170#ifdef INVARIANTS
171 panic("Hmm. thread_terminate() continues...");
172#endif
173#endif
174#endif
175}
176
177void
178sctp_startup_iterator(void)
179{
180 if (sctp_it_ctl.thread_proc) {
181 /* You only get one */
182 return;
183 }
184 /* Initialize global locks here, thus only once. */
185 SCTP_ITERATOR_LOCK_INIT();
186 SCTP_IPI_ITERATOR_WQ_INIT();
187 TAILQ_INIT(&sctp_it_ctl.iteratorhead);
188#if defined(__Userspace__)
189 if (sctp_userspace_thread_create(&sctp_it_ctl.thread_proc, &sctp_iterator_thread)) {
190 SCTP_PRINTF("ERROR: Creating sctp_iterator_thread failed.\n");
191 } else {
192 SCTP_BASE_VAR(iterator_thread_started) = 1;
193 }
194#elif defined(__FreeBSD__)
195 kproc_create(sctp_iterator_thread,
196 (void *)NULL,
197 &sctp_it_ctl.thread_proc,
198 0,
199 SCTP_KTHREAD_PAGES,
200 SCTP_KTRHEAD_NAME);
201#elif defined(__APPLE__)
202 kernel_thread_start((thread_continue_t)sctp_iterator_thread, NULL, &sctp_it_ctl.thread_proc);
203#endif
204}
205
206#ifdef INET6
207
208#if defined(__Userspace__)
209/* __Userspace__ TODO. struct in6_ifaddr is defined in sys/netinet6/in6_var.h
210 ip6_use_deprecated is defined as int ip6_use_deprecated = 1; in /src/sys/netinet6/in6_proto.c
211 */
212void
213sctp_gather_internal_ifa_flags(struct sctp_ifa *ifa)
214{
215 return; /* stub */
216}
217#else
218void
219sctp_gather_internal_ifa_flags(struct sctp_ifa *ifa)
220{
221 struct in6_ifaddr *ifa6;
222
223 ifa6 = (struct in6_ifaddr *)ifa->ifa;
224 ifa->flags = ifa6->ia6_flags;
225 if (!MODULE_GLOBAL(ip6_use_deprecated)) {
226 if (ifa->flags &
227 IN6_IFF_DEPRECATED) {
228 ifa->localifa_flags |= SCTP_ADDR_IFA_UNUSEABLE;
229 } else {
230 ifa->localifa_flags &= ~SCTP_ADDR_IFA_UNUSEABLE;
231 }
232 } else {
233 ifa->localifa_flags &= ~SCTP_ADDR_IFA_UNUSEABLE;
234 }
235 if (ifa->flags &
236 (IN6_IFF_DETACHED |
237 IN6_IFF_ANYCAST |
238 IN6_IFF_NOTREADY)) {
239 ifa->localifa_flags |= SCTP_ADDR_IFA_UNUSEABLE;
240 } else {
241 ifa->localifa_flags &= ~SCTP_ADDR_IFA_UNUSEABLE;
242 }
243}
244#endif /* __Userspace__ */
245#endif /* INET6 */
246
247#if !defined(__Userspace__)
248static uint32_t
249sctp_is_desired_interface_type(struct ifnet *ifn)
250{
251 int result;
252
253 /* check the interface type to see if it's one we care about */
254#if defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
255 switch(ifnet_type(ifn)) {
256#else
257 switch (ifn->if_type) {
258#endif
259 case IFT_ETHER:
260 case IFT_ISO88023:
261 case IFT_ISO88024:
262 case IFT_ISO88025:
263 case IFT_ISO88026:
264 case IFT_STARLAN:
265 case IFT_P10:
266 case IFT_P80:
267 case IFT_HY:
268 case IFT_FDDI:
269 case IFT_XETHER:
270 case IFT_ISDNBASIC:
271 case IFT_ISDNPRIMARY:
272 case IFT_PTPSERIAL:
273 case IFT_OTHER:
274 case IFT_PPP:
275 case IFT_LOOP:
276 case IFT_SLIP:
277 case IFT_GIF:
278 case IFT_L2VLAN:
279 case IFT_STF:
280#if !(defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__Userspace__))
281 case IFT_IP:
282 case IFT_IPOVERCDLC:
283 case IFT_IPOVERCLAW:
284 case IFT_PROPVIRTUAL: /* NetGraph Virtual too */
285 case IFT_VIRTUALIPADDRESS:
286#endif
287 result = 1;
288 break;
289 default:
290 result = 0;
291 }
292
293 return (result);
294}
295#endif
296#if defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
297
298int
299sctp_is_vmware_interface(struct ifnet *ifn)
300{
301 return (strncmp(ifnet_name(ifn), "vmnet", 5) == 0);
302}
303
304#endif
305
306#if defined(_WIN32) && defined(__Userspace__)
307#ifdef MALLOC
308#undef MALLOC
309#define MALLOC(x) HeapAlloc(GetProcessHeap(), 0, (x))
310#endif
311#ifdef FREE
312#undef FREE
313#define FREE(x) HeapFree(GetProcessHeap(), 0, (x))
314#endif
315static void
316sctp_init_ifns_for_vrf(int vrfid)
317{
318#if defined(INET) || defined(INET6)
319 struct sctp_ifa *sctp_ifa;
320 DWORD Err, AdapterAddrsSize;
321 PIP_ADAPTER_ADDRESSES pAdapterAddrs, pAdapt;
322 PIP_ADAPTER_UNICAST_ADDRESS pUnicast;
323#endif
324
325#ifdef INET
326 AdapterAddrsSize = 0;
327
328 if ((Err = GetAdaptersAddresses(AF_INET, 0, NULL, NULL, &AdapterAddrsSize)) != 0) {
329 if ((Err != ERROR_BUFFER_OVERFLOW) && (Err != ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_BUFFER)) {
330 SCTP_PRINTF("GetAdaptersV4Addresses() sizing failed with error code %d\n", Err);
331 SCTP_PRINTF("err = %d; AdapterAddrsSize = %d\n", Err, AdapterAddrsSize);
332 return;
333 }
334 }
335
336 /* Allocate memory from sizing information */
337 if ((pAdapterAddrs = (PIP_ADAPTER_ADDRESSES) GlobalAlloc(GPTR, AdapterAddrsSize)) == NULL) {
338 SCTP_PRINTF("Memory allocation error!\n");
339 return;
340 }
341 /* Get actual adapter information */
342 if ((Err = GetAdaptersAddresses(AF_INET, 0, NULL, pAdapterAddrs, &AdapterAddrsSize)) != ERROR_SUCCESS) {
343 SCTP_PRINTF("GetAdaptersV4Addresses() failed with error code %d\n", Err);
344 FREE(pAdapterAddrs);
345 return;
346 }
347 /* Enumerate through each returned adapter and save its information */
348 for (pAdapt = pAdapterAddrs; pAdapt; pAdapt = pAdapt->Next) {
349 if (pAdapt->IfType == IF_TYPE_IEEE80211 || pAdapt->IfType == IF_TYPE_ETHERNET_CSMACD) {
350 for (pUnicast = pAdapt->FirstUnicastAddress; pUnicast; pUnicast = pUnicast->Next) {
351 if (IN4_ISLINKLOCAL_ADDRESS(&(((struct sockaddr_in *)(pUnicast->Address.lpSockaddr))->sin_addr))) {
352 continue;
353 }
354 sctp_ifa = sctp_add_addr_to_vrf(0,
355 NULL,
356 pAdapt->IfIndex,
357 (pAdapt->IfType == IF_TYPE_IEEE80211)?MIB_IF_TYPE_ETHERNET:pAdapt->IfType,
358 pAdapt->AdapterName,
359 NULL,
360 pUnicast->Address.lpSockaddr,
361 pAdapt->Flags,
362 0);
363 if (sctp_ifa) {
364 sctp_ifa->localifa_flags &= ~SCTP_ADDR_DEFER_USE;
365 }
366 }
367 }
368 }
369 FREE(pAdapterAddrs);
370#endif
371#ifdef INET6
372 AdapterAddrsSize = 0;
373
374 if ((Err = GetAdaptersAddresses(AF_INET6, 0, NULL, NULL, &AdapterAddrsSize)) != 0) {
375 if ((Err != ERROR_BUFFER_OVERFLOW) && (Err != ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_BUFFER)) {
376 SCTP_PRINTF("GetAdaptersV6Addresses() sizing failed with error code %d\n", Err);
377 SCTP_PRINTF("err = %d; AdapterAddrsSize = %d\n", Err, AdapterAddrsSize);
378 return;
379 }
380 }
381 /* Allocate memory from sizing information */
382 if ((pAdapterAddrs = (PIP_ADAPTER_ADDRESSES) GlobalAlloc(GPTR, AdapterAddrsSize)) == NULL) {
383 SCTP_PRINTF("Memory allocation error!\n");
384 return;
385 }
386 /* Get actual adapter information */
387 if ((Err = GetAdaptersAddresses(AF_INET6, 0, NULL, pAdapterAddrs, &AdapterAddrsSize)) != ERROR_SUCCESS) {
388 SCTP_PRINTF("GetAdaptersV6Addresses() failed with error code %d\n", Err);
389 FREE(pAdapterAddrs);
390 return;
391 }
392 /* Enumerate through each returned adapter and save its information */
393 for (pAdapt = pAdapterAddrs; pAdapt; pAdapt = pAdapt->Next) {
394 if (pAdapt->IfType == IF_TYPE_IEEE80211 || pAdapt->IfType == IF_TYPE_ETHERNET_CSMACD) {
395 for (pUnicast = pAdapt->FirstUnicastAddress; pUnicast; pUnicast = pUnicast->Next) {
396 sctp_ifa = sctp_add_addr_to_vrf(0,
397 NULL,
398 pAdapt->Ipv6IfIndex,
399 (pAdapt->IfType == IF_TYPE_IEEE80211)?MIB_IF_TYPE_ETHERNET:pAdapt->IfType,
400 pAdapt->AdapterName,
401 NULL,
402 pUnicast->Address.lpSockaddr,
403 pAdapt->Flags,
404 0);
405 if (sctp_ifa) {
406 sctp_ifa->localifa_flags &= ~SCTP_ADDR_DEFER_USE;
407 }
408 }
409 }
410 }
411 FREE(pAdapterAddrs);
412#endif
413}
414#elif defined(__Userspace__)
415static void
416sctp_init_ifns_for_vrf(int vrfid)
417{
418#if defined(INET) || defined(INET6)
419 int rc;
420 struct ifaddrs *ifa, *ifas;
421 struct sctp_ifa *sctp_ifa;
422 uint32_t ifa_flags;
423
424 rc = getifaddrs(&ifas);
425 if (rc != 0) {
426 return;
427 }
428 for (ifa = ifas; ifa; ifa = ifa->ifa_next) {
429 if (ifa->ifa_addr == NULL) {
430 continue;
431 }
432#if !defined(INET)
433 if (ifa->ifa_addr->sa_family != AF_INET6) {
434 /* non inet6 skip */
435 continue;
436 }
437#elif !defined(INET6)
438 if (ifa->ifa_addr->sa_family != AF_INET) {
439 /* non inet skip */
440 continue;
441 }
442#else
443 if ((ifa->ifa_addr->sa_family != AF_INET) && (ifa->ifa_addr->sa_family != AF_INET6)) {
444 /* non inet/inet6 skip */
445 continue;
446 }
447#endif
448#if defined(INET6)
449 if ((ifa->ifa_addr->sa_family == AF_INET6) &&
450 IN6_IS_ADDR_UNSPECIFIED(&((struct sockaddr_in6 *)ifa->ifa_addr)->sin6_addr)) {
451 /* skip unspecifed addresses */
452 continue;
453 }
454#endif
455#if defined(INET)
456 if (ifa->ifa_addr->sa_family == AF_INET &&
457 ((struct sockaddr_in *)ifa->ifa_addr)->sin_addr.s_addr == 0) {
458 continue;
459 }
460#endif
461 ifa_flags = 0;
462 sctp_ifa = sctp_add_addr_to_vrf(vrfid,
463 NULL,
464 if_nametoindex(ifa->ifa_name),
465 0,
466 ifa->ifa_name,
467 NULL,
468 ifa->ifa_addr,
469 ifa_flags,
470 0);
471 if (sctp_ifa) {
472 sctp_ifa->localifa_flags &= ~SCTP_ADDR_DEFER_USE;
473 }
474 }
475 freeifaddrs(ifas);
476#endif
477}
478#endif
479#if defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
480static void
481sctp_init_ifns_for_vrf(int vrfid)
482{
483 /* Here we must apply ANY locks needed by the
484 * IFN we access and also make sure we lock
485 * any IFA that exists as we float through the
486 * list of IFA's
487 */
488 struct ifnet **ifnetlist;
489 uint32_t i, j, count;
490 char name[SCTP_IFNAMSIZ];
491 struct ifnet *ifn;
492 struct ifaddr **ifaddrlist;
493 struct ifaddr *ifa;
494 struct in6_ifaddr *ifa6;
495 struct sctp_ifa *sctp_ifa;
496 uint32_t ifa_flags;
497
498 if (ifnet_list_get(IFNET_FAMILY_ANY, &ifnetlist, &count) != 0) {
499 return;
500 }
501 for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
502 ifn = ifnetlist[i];
503 if (SCTP_BASE_SYSCTL(sctp_ignore_vmware_interfaces) && sctp_is_vmware_interface(ifn)) {
504 continue;
505 }
506 if (sctp_is_desired_interface_type(ifn) == 0) {
507 /* non desired type */
508 continue;
509 }
510 if (ifnet_get_address_list(ifn, &ifaddrlist) != 0) {
511 continue;
512 }
513 for (j = 0; ifaddrlist[j] != NULL; j++) {
514 ifa = ifaddrlist[j];
515 if (ifa->ifa_addr == NULL) {
516 continue;
517 }
518 if ((ifa->ifa_addr->sa_family != AF_INET) && (ifa->ifa_addr->sa_family != AF_INET6)) {
519 /* non inet/inet6 skip */
520 continue;
521 }
522 if (ifa->ifa_addr->sa_family == AF_INET6) {
523 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_UNSPECIFIED(&((struct sockaddr_in6 *)ifa->ifa_addr)->sin6_addr)) {
524 /* skip unspecifed addresses */
525 continue;
526 }
527 } else {
528 if (((struct sockaddr_in *)ifa->ifa_addr)->sin_addr.s_addr == INADDR_ANY) {
529 continue;
530 }
531 }
532 if (ifa->ifa_addr->sa_family == AF_INET6) {
533 ifa6 = (struct in6_ifaddr *)ifa;
534 ifa_flags = ifa6->ia6_flags;
535 } else {
536 ifa_flags = 0;
537 }
538 SCTP_SNPRINTF(name, SCTP_IFNAMSIZ, "%s%d", ifnet_name(ifn), ifnet_unit(ifn));
539 sctp_ifa = sctp_add_addr_to_vrf(vrfid,
540 (void *)ifn, /* XXX */
541 ifnet_index(ifn),
542 ifnet_type(ifn),
543 name,
544 (void *)ifa, /* XXX */
545 ifa->ifa_addr,
546 ifa_flags,
547 0);
548 if (sctp_ifa) {
549 sctp_ifa->localifa_flags &= ~SCTP_ADDR_DEFER_USE;
550 }
551 }
552 ifnet_free_address_list(ifaddrlist);
553 }
554 ifnet_list_free(ifnetlist);
555}
556#endif
557#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
558static void
559sctp_init_ifns_for_vrf(int vrfid)
560{
561 /* Here we must apply ANY locks needed by the
562 * IFN we access and also make sure we lock
563 * any IFA that exists as we float through the
564 * list of IFA's
565 */
566 struct epoch_tracker et;
567 struct ifnet *ifn;
568 struct ifaddr *ifa;
569 struct sctp_ifa *sctp_ifa;
570 uint32_t ifa_flags;
571#ifdef INET6
572 struct in6_ifaddr *ifa6;
573#endif
574
575 IFNET_RLOCK();
576 NET_EPOCH_ENTER(et);
577 CK_STAILQ_FOREACH(ifn, &MODULE_GLOBAL(ifnet), if_link) {
578 if (sctp_is_desired_interface_type(ifn) == 0) {
579 /* non desired type */
580 continue;
581 }
582 CK_STAILQ_FOREACH(ifa, &ifn->if_addrhead, ifa_link) {
583 if (ifa->ifa_addr == NULL) {
584 continue;
585 }
586 switch (ifa->ifa_addr->sa_family) {
587#ifdef INET
588 case AF_INET:
589 if (((struct sockaddr_in *)ifa->ifa_addr)->sin_addr.s_addr == 0) {
590 continue;
591 }
592 break;
593#endif
594#ifdef INET6
595 case AF_INET6:
596 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_UNSPECIFIED(&((struct sockaddr_in6 *)ifa->ifa_addr)->sin6_addr)) {
597 /* skip unspecifed addresses */
598 continue;
599 }
600 break;
601#endif
602 default:
603 continue;
604 }
605 switch (ifa->ifa_addr->sa_family) {
606#ifdef INET
607 case AF_INET:
608 ifa_flags = 0;
609 break;
610#endif
611#ifdef INET6
612 case AF_INET6:
613 ifa6 = (struct in6_ifaddr *)ifa;
614 ifa_flags = ifa6->ia6_flags;
615 break;
616#endif
617 default:
618 ifa_flags = 0;
619 break;
620 }
621 sctp_ifa = sctp_add_addr_to_vrf(vrfid,
622 (void *)ifn,
623 ifn->if_index,
624 ifn->if_type,
625 ifn->if_xname,
626 (void *)ifa,
627 ifa->ifa_addr,
628 ifa_flags,
629 0);
630 if (sctp_ifa) {
631 sctp_ifa->localifa_flags &= ~SCTP_ADDR_DEFER_USE;
632 }
633 }
634 }
635 NET_EPOCH_EXIT(et);
636 IFNET_RUNLOCK();
637}
638#endif
639
640void
641sctp_init_vrf_list(int vrfid)
642{
643 if (vrfid > SCTP_MAX_VRF_ID)
644 /* can't do that */
645 return;
646
647 /* Don't care about return here */
648 (void)sctp_allocate_vrf(vrfid);
649
650 /* Now we need to build all the ifn's
651 * for this vrf and there addresses
652 */
653 sctp_init_ifns_for_vrf(vrfid);
654}
655
656void
657sctp_addr_change(struct ifaddr *ifa, int cmd)
658{
659#if defined(__Userspace__)
660 return;
661#else
662 uint32_t ifa_flags = 0;
663
664 if (SCTP_BASE_VAR(sctp_pcb_initialized) == 0) {
665 return;
666 }
667 /* BSD only has one VRF, if this changes
668 * we will need to hook in the right
669 * things here to get the id to pass to
670 * the address management routine.
671 */
672 if (SCTP_BASE_VAR(first_time) == 0) {
673 /* Special test to see if my ::1 will showup with this */
674 SCTP_BASE_VAR(first_time) = 1;
675 sctp_init_ifns_for_vrf(SCTP_DEFAULT_VRFID);
676 }
677
678 if ((cmd != RTM_ADD) && (cmd != RTM_DELETE)) {
679 /* don't know what to do with this */
680 return;
681 }
682
683 if (ifa->ifa_addr == NULL) {
684 return;
685 }
686 if (sctp_is_desired_interface_type(ifa->ifa_ifp) == 0) {
687 /* non desired type */
688 return;
689 }
690 switch (ifa->ifa_addr->sa_family) {
691#ifdef INET
692 case AF_INET:
693 if (((struct sockaddr_in *)ifa->ifa_addr)->sin_addr.s_addr == 0) {
694 return;
695 }
696 break;
697#endif
698#ifdef INET6
699 case AF_INET6:
700 ifa_flags = ((struct in6_ifaddr *)ifa)->ia6_flags;
701 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_UNSPECIFIED(&((struct sockaddr_in6 *)ifa->ifa_addr)->sin6_addr)) {
702 /* skip unspecifed addresses */
703 return;
704 }
705 break;
706#endif
707 default:
708 /* non inet/inet6 skip */
709 return;
710 }
711 if (cmd == RTM_ADD) {
712 (void)sctp_add_addr_to_vrf(SCTP_DEFAULT_VRFID, (void *)ifa->ifa_ifp,
713#if defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
714 ifnet_index(ifa->ifa_ifp), ifnet_type(ifa->ifa_ifp), ifnet_name(ifa->ifa_ifp),
715#else
716 ifa->ifa_ifp->if_index, ifa->ifa_ifp->if_type, ifa->ifa_ifp->if_xname,
717#endif
718 (void *)ifa, ifa->ifa_addr, ifa_flags, 1);
719 } else {
720 sctp_del_addr_from_vrf(SCTP_DEFAULT_VRFID, ifa->ifa_addr,
721#if defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
722 ifnet_index(ifa->ifa_ifp),
723 ifnet_name(ifa->ifa_ifp));
724#else
725 ifa->ifa_ifp->if_index,
726 ifa->ifa_ifp->if_xname);
727#endif
728
729 /* We don't bump refcount here so when it completes
730 * the final delete will happen.
731 */
732 }
733#endif
734}
735
736#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
737void
738sctp_addr_change_event_handler(void *arg __unused, struct ifaddr *ifa, int cmd) {
739 sctp_addr_change(ifa, cmd);
740}
741#endif
742#if defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
743void
744sctp_add_or_del_interfaces(int (*pred)(struct ifnet *), int add)
745{
746 struct ifnet **ifnetlist;
747 struct ifaddr **ifaddrlist;
748 uint32_t i, j, count;
749
750 if (ifnet_list_get(IFNET_FAMILY_ANY, &ifnetlist, &count) != 0) {
751 return;
752 }
753 for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
754 if (!(*pred)(ifnetlist[i])) {
755 continue;
756 }
757 if (ifnet_get_address_list(ifnetlist[i], &ifaddrlist) != 0) {
758 continue;
759 }
760 for (j = 0; ifaddrlist[j] != NULL; j++) {
761 sctp_addr_change(ifaddrlist[j], add ? RTM_ADD : RTM_DELETE);
762 }
763 ifnet_free_address_list(ifaddrlist);
764 }
765 ifnet_list_free(ifnetlist);
766 return;
767}
768#endif
769
770struct mbuf *
771sctp_get_mbuf_for_msg(unsigned int space_needed, int want_header,
772 int how, int allonebuf, int type)
773{
774 struct mbuf *m = NULL;
775#if defined(__FreeBSD__) || defined(__Userspace__)
776#if defined(__Userspace__)
777 m = m_getm2(NULL, space_needed, how, type, want_header ? M_PKTHDR : 0, allonebuf);
778#else
779 m = m_getm2(NULL, space_needed, how, type, want_header ? M_PKTHDR : 0);
780#endif
781 if (m == NULL) {
782 /* bad, no memory */
783 return (m);
784 }
785#if !defined(__Userspace__)
786 if (allonebuf) {
787 if (SCTP_BUF_SIZE(m) < space_needed) {
788 m_freem(m);
789 return (NULL);
790 }
791 KASSERT(SCTP_BUF_NEXT(m) == NULL, ("%s: no chain allowed", __func__));
792 }
793#endif
794#ifdef SCTP_MBUF_LOGGING
795 if (SCTP_BASE_SYSCTL(sctp_logging_level) & SCTP_MBUF_LOGGING_ENABLE) {
796 sctp_log_mb(m, SCTP_MBUF_IALLOC);
797 }
798#endif
799#else
800 int mbuf_threshold;
801 unsigned int size;
802
803 if (want_header) {
804 MGETHDR(m, how, type);
805 size = MHLEN;
806 } else {
807 MGET(m, how, type);
808 size = MLEN;
809 }
810 if (m == NULL) {
811 return (NULL);
812 }
813 if (allonebuf == 0) {
814 mbuf_threshold = SCTP_BASE_SYSCTL(sctp_mbuf_threshold_count);
815 } else {
816 mbuf_threshold = 1;
817 }
818
819 if (space_needed > (unsigned int)(((mbuf_threshold - 1) * MLEN) + MHLEN)) {
820 MCLGET(m, how);
821 if (m == NULL) {
822 return (NULL);
823 }
824 if (SCTP_BUF_IS_EXTENDED(m) == 0) {
825 sctp_m_freem(m);
826 return (NULL);
827 }
828 size = SCTP_BUF_EXTEND_SIZE(m);
829 }
830 if (allonebuf != 0 && size < space_needed) {
831 m_freem(m);
832 return (NULL);
833 }
834 SCTP_BUF_LEN(m) = 0;
835 SCTP_BUF_NEXT(m) = SCTP_BUF_NEXT_PKT(m) = NULL;
836#ifdef SCTP_MBUF_LOGGING
837 if (SCTP_BASE_SYSCTL(sctp_logging_level) & SCTP_MBUF_LOGGING_ENABLE) {
838 sctp_log_mb(m, SCTP_MBUF_IALLOC);
839 }
840#endif
841#endif
842 return (m);
843}
844
845#ifdef SCTP_PACKET_LOGGING
846void
847sctp_packet_log(struct mbuf *m)
848{
849 int *lenat, thisone;
850 void *copyto;
851 uint32_t *tick_tock;
852 int length;
853 int total_len;
854 int grabbed_lock = 0;
855 int value, newval, thisend, thisbegin;
856 /*
857 * Buffer layout.
858 * -sizeof this entry (total_len)
859 * -previous end (value)
860 * -ticks of log (ticks)
861 * o -ip packet
862 * o -as logged
863 * - where this started (thisbegin)
864 * x <--end points here
865 */
866 length = SCTP_HEADER_LEN(m);
867 total_len = SCTP_SIZE32((length + (4 * sizeof(int))));
868 /* Log a packet to the buffer. */
869 if (total_len> SCTP_PACKET_LOG_SIZE) {
870 /* Can't log this packet I have not a buffer big enough */
871 return;
872 }
873 if (length < (int)(SCTP_MIN_V4_OVERHEAD + sizeof(struct sctp_cookie_ack_chunk))) {
874 return;
875 }
876 atomic_add_int(&SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_writers), 1);
877 try_again:
878 if (SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_writers) > SCTP_PKTLOG_WRITERS_NEED_LOCK) {
879 SCTP_IP_PKTLOG_LOCK();
880 grabbed_lock = 1;
881 again_locked:
882 value = SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_end);
883 newval = SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_end) + total_len;
884 if (newval >= SCTP_PACKET_LOG_SIZE) {
885 /* we wrapped */
886 thisbegin = 0;
887 thisend = total_len;
888 } else {
889 thisbegin = SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_end);
890 thisend = newval;
891 }
892 if (!(atomic_cmpset_int(&SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_end), value, thisend))) {
893 goto again_locked;
894 }
895 } else {
896 value = SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_end);
897 newval = SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_end) + total_len;
898 if (newval >= SCTP_PACKET_LOG_SIZE) {
899 /* we wrapped */
900 thisbegin = 0;
901 thisend = total_len;
902 } else {
903 thisbegin = SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_end);
904 thisend = newval;
905 }
906 if (!(atomic_cmpset_int(&SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_end), value, thisend))) {
907 goto try_again;
908 }
909 }
910 /* Sanity check */
911 if (thisend >= SCTP_PACKET_LOG_SIZE) {
912 SCTP_PRINTF("Insanity stops a log thisbegin:%d thisend:%d writers:%d lock:%d end:%d\n",
913 thisbegin,
914 thisend,
915 SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_writers),
916 grabbed_lock,
917 SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_end));
918 SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_end) = 0;
919 goto no_log;
920 }
921 lenat = (int *)&SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_buffer)[thisbegin];
922 *lenat = total_len;
923 lenat++;
924 *lenat = value;
925 lenat++;
926 tick_tock = (uint32_t *)lenat;
927 lenat++;
928 *tick_tock = sctp_get_tick_count();
929 copyto = (void *)lenat;
930 thisone = thisend - sizeof(int);
931 lenat = (int *)&SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_buffer)[thisone];
932 *lenat = thisbegin;
933 if (grabbed_lock) {
934 SCTP_IP_PKTLOG_UNLOCK();
935 grabbed_lock = 0;
936 }
937 m_copydata(m, 0, length, (caddr_t)copyto);
938 no_log:
939 if (grabbed_lock) {
940 SCTP_IP_PKTLOG_UNLOCK();
941 }
942 atomic_subtract_int(&SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_writers), 1);
943}
944
945int
946sctp_copy_out_packet_log(uint8_t *target, int length)
947{
948 /* We wind through the packet log starting at
949 * start copying up to length bytes out.
950 * We return the number of bytes copied.
951 */
952 int tocopy, this_copy;
953 int *lenat;
954 int did_delay = 0;
955
956 tocopy = length;
957 if (length < (int)(2 * sizeof(int))) {
958 /* not enough room */
959 return (0);
960 }
961 if (SCTP_PKTLOG_WRITERS_NEED_LOCK) {
962 atomic_add_int(&SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_writers), SCTP_PKTLOG_WRITERS_NEED_LOCK);
963 again:
964 if ((did_delay == 0) && (SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_writers) != SCTP_PKTLOG_WRITERS_NEED_LOCK)) {
965 /* we delay here for just a moment hoping the writer(s) that were
966 * present when we entered will have left and we only have
967 * locking ones that will contend with us for the lock. This
968 * does not assure 100% access, but its good enough for
969 * a logging facility like this.
970 */
971 did_delay = 1;
972 DELAY(10);
973 goto again;
974 }
975 }
976 SCTP_IP_PKTLOG_LOCK();
977 lenat = (int *)target;
978 *lenat = SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_end);
979 lenat++;
980 this_copy = min((length - sizeof(int)), SCTP_PACKET_LOG_SIZE);
981 memcpy((void *)lenat, (void *)SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_buffer), this_copy);
982 if (SCTP_PKTLOG_WRITERS_NEED_LOCK) {
983 atomic_subtract_int(&SCTP_BASE_VAR(packet_log_writers),
984 SCTP_PKTLOG_WRITERS_NEED_LOCK);
985 }
986 SCTP_IP_PKTLOG_UNLOCK();
987 return (this_copy + sizeof(int));
988}
989
990#endif
